title: Matilda of Scotland
summary: Matilda of Scotland (originally christened Edith,[lower-alpha 1] 1080 â€“ 1 May 1118), also known as Good Queen Maud or Matilda of Blessed Memory, was Queen of England and Duchess of Normandy as the first wife of King Henry I. She acted as regent of England on several occasions during Henry's absences: in 1104, 1107, 1108, and 1111.[1]
